Ideally I'd use node.getParentIndex().ifPresent(..) but it needs access to the non-final nodeIndex which is slightly annoying so the if structure is probably the best approach.

Is this actually in the spec? Surprised we don't just go with no change in this case (ie if we don't have something clearly better, stick with what we have).

Yeah, this is what we have in the original spec code:
head = children.stream()
              .filter(child -> get_latest_attesting_balance(store, child).compareTo(max) == 0)
              .max(Comparator.comparing(Bytes::toHexString))
              .get();```

In comments we have:
  // Sort by latest attesting balance with ties broken lexicographically
Although I'm wondering if Bytes.compare() as I do now, or Bytes.toHexString() as I did in ForkChoiceUtil, does correct lexicographical comparison
We might have had that as a hidden bug due to not having fork choice reference tests.
I believe they sort the same way whether you use the raw bytes or the hex string.
I'd suggest calling this ForkChoiceStrategy and then you'd have ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy and StubForkChoiceStrategy as the two implementations.
Done.

This test name implies it's testing ComputeDeltas class but the function is actually in ProtoArrayForkChoice.   Probably should rename this to either ProtoArrayForkChoiceTest since we don't currently have one of those or ProtoArrayForkChoiceComputeDeltasTest if we do want to separate test classes for the one production class (which sometimes happens if you need different setup or just a lot of tests etc).
The other option would be to move the static compute_deltas method to a DeltaUtils kind of class and this is the test for that.

I did not understand this to be honest:

ProtoArrayForkChoiceComputeDeltasTest if we do want to separate test classes for the one production class

Nevertheless, I switched to ProtoArrayForkChoiceTest , since that makes sense.
